definition: lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
helm/rudder

sentences.english: In this mode, the position of the vessel is controlled by a PME.
sentences.chinese: 这种模式有时叫见风使舵，船舶位置由PME控制。

sentences.english: She would balance and temporize endlessly before reaching a decision.
sentences.chinese: 她在做出决定前会不断地犹豫观望和见风使舵。

sentences.english: You are fit for a captain, having it both ways .
sentences.chinese: 你适合当船长，擅长见风使舵。

definition: to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
toady/bootlicker
be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
related.word: 见人说人话，见鬼说鬼话

definition: snob
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to bend with the wind
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to resort to bragging and flattering
